Tracey Annison wrote:

> So, is this kind of testing important enough to warrant all the effort
> it takes to write & keep up to date?
> Should we care what method got called on our mock, or even whether it
> did get called at all? Or are we really only interested in the result
> of the main method we're testing?

I believe you should forget mocks for now and just write tests. Write 
fat, slow, brittle tests that, nonetheless, pass and drive your design 
incrementally. I did that when I first used JUnit and I can't imagine 
trying to learn writing tests, driving design and using mocks all at the 
same time!

My first real test suite had 175 tests and took 12 minutes to run, but 
it enabled me to do in 3 weeks what I'd previously needed 3 months to 
do. The fact that I could /now/ do it in 1 week with my vastly-improved 
technique was irrelevant then.

Good luck.
